Article Title: Hernanes just might carve out a role at Juventus after all
Comment Body:
Can anyone enlighten me as to how he’s been doing lately?
He played well vs Man City in that first game, but then it was a huge drop. He just doesn’t look comfortable on the ball. Last game he did better than before, had an OK performance with a few recoveries and some good passes but he would get the ball and lose it quickly like he was starting one step too late. This happened often and close to Juve’s box. He does look dangerous whenever he manages to take shot. But this doesn’t happen often due to tactical reasons, lack of confidence or lack of trust from teammates(?). I doubt he will play as anything resembling a trequartista again though.

I just reviewed the votes from the captains of the top 40 ranked national teams and it reveals what a farce this award truly is. Everybody just votes for their teammates knowing — in fairness — that their votes will be made public. The process just has enormous impurity to it, at least IMO.
On a side note, though, I got a chuckle in learning that Pogba’s own brother Florentin (captain of Guinea) didn’t vote for Paul. Such a big brother thing to do!

Article Title: Hernanes just might carve out a role at Juventus after all
Comment Title: This award has been a joke...
Comment Body:
… since the FIFA World player of the Year and the REAL Ballon D’Or joined up. It used to be credible. I think the last one was Cannavaro or Kaka, after one of them i think the joined up and it has been a joke since. 2010 should defo have been won by Sneijder, 2012 by Iniesta, 2014 should have been Neuer, Lahm or Muller. I mean what more does Muller have to do to get recognised. Hes won the world cup, champions league and many other BuLi’s and German Cups all before his 26th birthday. Ballon D’Or is a joke and so is the TOTY. 4 Real players, i get Ronaldo but why the others.
Buffon? Marchisio? Bonucci?
Oh well at least we know what the FIFA awards are worth.

Article Title: Hernanes just might carve out a role at Juventus after all
Comment Title: I'm not sure how they could fix it really...
Comment Body:
This will always be the case when you decide a global award by a vote by people who would never have the time to assess every game and accomplishments… I can even understand their bias(who the heck has the time to analyse every la liga games when you’re playing in the epl?) so, these people most likely vote based on familiarity (voting for their own teams, countrymen), personal agenda (e.g. messi not voting ronaldo, ronaldo not voting messi), and trends (whoever the media raves on about for most of the year). I’d do the same if I was asked to vote.
why don’t they set up a committee that nominates these players by representatives of each league? e.g. those who play in their league votes for their top 5 nominees for their league only, do this by league and competition. Then at least the shortlist look more respectable I’d bet.

Article Title: Hernanes just might carve out a role at Juventus after all
Comment Body: Or just let me decide

Article Title: Hernanes just might carve out a role at Juventus after all
Comment Body: The current system is wrong as you stated for multiple reasons. I think it should be left to the fans, the people who actually make football work and give money week in week out to fill the stadiums. A general poll as you say for the top 5 or 3 per league and then a top 3 overall in a second poll. Asking manager and team captains is just wrong on so many levels.

Maybe they can take 50 – 100 journalists from around the world and use them to vote, as they tend to watch more than one league and the league as whole it will be a much less biased award.

Article Title: Hernanes just might carve out a role at Juventus after all
Comment Body:
A few good passes and long-range shots don’t mean he’s good enough to stay if that were the case then we should also have held on to de Ceglie, Vucinic, Krasic and Eljero Elia. Nor is he in the situation of a youngster needing to be trusted.
Hernanes strikes me as the kind of player who does just enough to get on the highlight reel and fool people into believing there’s hope to be had in him. A long-range effort here and there and you’d think he’s not too shabby. But once you analyse his displays outside of these rare moments, he’s horrendous, offers little protection to his defence (those late jitters against Sampdoria can partly be attributed to his ineptness in controlling the tempo and the abll), mostly passes the ball sideways and backwards. With Pereyra and Asamoah returning to the fold, we now have those 2 plus Marchisio, Sturaro, Khedira and Pogba available for 3 midfield spots. Barring a major mishap to one of them, Hernanes shouldn’t be getting anywhere near the starting XI.
Most damning of all for him is that the team embarked on a winning run right when he became unavailable through suspension, then injury. Not too fussed as he arrived for a low price but he’s well well below what one would expect at such a club. In fact if it weren’t for him I’d give Marotta 10/10 for his transfer dealings in the summer… factoring in Hernanes it’s more like a 9.5 (9 when he’s on the team and hurting it).
Cuadrado is another one I have trouble with. He was in the starting line-up for most of the woeful early part of the season. His winning goal against Torino may well have been a turning point in Juve’s season… yet after that the side has played a lot better since he’s been demoted to a substitute role.

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI
Comment Body:
The relationship between Umberto Agnelli and Pavel Nedved was famous. Umberto used to take morning walks to Pavel’s home in the outskirts of Torino and would occasionally join the Czech and his wife for coffee. Pavel credits the elder Agnelli greatly with helping him settle in at Juve during a very tough period for him in his career; some find it quite difficult to switch to Juve in a high-profile fashion (they can’t all be Dybala, after all). This relationship with the president showed Pavel that Juventus wasn’t just another football club with talented players, but a family where everyone looks out for the other and is concerned with their well-being. Pavel was able to adjust to Juve’s demands and atmosphere and went on to win [perhaps] the 2nd most precious trophy in all of calcio, the Ballon d’Or. He is obviously paying back that faith, trust and collegiality that Umberto showed him in his current director’s role.
I sometimes also wonder how much Andrea learned from his father – and how much history may be repeating itself before our eyes. Seeing Andrea goofing around with the players, constantly at Vinovo, and hearing how he talks about his club, I cant help but feel that that same attitude his father brought to Juve, Andrea is trying to mimic.
Here in a goofy photo opp, we see yet another Juventus midfielder of whom we expect the world week in and out, with the president by his side, lightening the mood a bit. One of the ambitious Frenchman’s many goals is that very same trophy that our Czech Fury brought back to Torino in 2003 – I hope he understands how well suited the current climate is to achieve those lofty goals.

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI
Comment Body:

I have a strong sense that he does, despite the attention-seeking and non-committal comments of his agent. He just seems so integrated into the team, with a very strong bond existing between him and his teammates. But I suppose only time will tell.

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI
Comment Body:
Even Messi winning it is wrong. This award should be for individual stats of the last years, goals, assist and so on. And in that department, no doubt Ronaldo was better than Messi. I think he scored like 17 goals last CL and already has 11 in this seasons’ CL group stage. Also, in La Liga he has been more prolific than Messi and they have just about the same amount of assists. Then, IF they are judging by trophies won by a specific team, which is wrong because it’s an individual award, then why on Earth didn’t Sneijder win it in 2010? Don’t get me wrong here, I despise Inter very very, VERY, much, but the guy played a pivotal role in Inter’s triplete and also took Holland to a World Cup final. Also, I remember another year when Ronaldo was better with lots of more goals and so on, and again Messi won it. So it’s not even clear on what ground are they giving the award, is it the trophies (Sneijder?!) or personal stats – goals, assists and so on (C. Ronaldo 2011 or 2012 and 2015)?
And what pains me more is absence of Buffon. He was better than Neur both when it comes to trophies and CL finals and better on an individual level, and everyone knows that. Also, Sergio Ramos and Marcelo? MODRIĆ?! The guy was injured for like 5 months, didn’t even play. This award is so unfair that I can’t help but get mad.
My only explanation is that it is sponosored by Addidas. Messi is with Addidas and Ronaldo with Nike. Also, Neuer and Ramos and Modrić and Marcelo are all with Addidas, at least their teams are, for longer period than Juventus (who is just a few months with Addidas). My biggest proof on this Addidas theory is when Messi won the best player of the 2014 WC award. He was just average. He didn’t score a single goal after the group stage. Muller and Rodriguez were a lot better, just to name a few.
I stopped caring about these awards since I figured it was all fixed but I just can’t help but get angry when some Juve players don’t get nominated, above all Buffon and AT LEAST one of Chiellini, Bonucci or Barzagli.

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI
Comment Body:
Stats aren’t the only thing that determine which player is better, Messi on the pitch plays better than Ronaldo, therefore he’s the better player.
I do agree with you that the idea of the award is stupid in general, I also agree with many of your points. I honestly think "individual" awards on a game that depends heavily on team play is pointless.

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI
Comment Body: Jonathan Wilson has always been adamant that individual awards are meaningless in a team game like football.

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI
Comment Body:
It has less space in a team game but sometimes it is required merely to show and recognise the influence and effort of single player carrying the team for example how Rodriquez carried Colombia in the WC, tho like the article someone posted suggesting why De Gea shd get Ballon D’Or (lol) they shd divide it into categories like GK, defense, midfield and attack coz there is no such thing as overall best player its just most inform/consistent player in a position. I doubt messi/cr7 can play in defense or FB or CDM or GK and I doubt Buffon can play as a striker.
Tho awards are meaningless nowadays it used to be good as journalists used to vote for them, they at least watch all the players to form a much better opinion than coaches and captains. I mean how many players/NT coaches would hv tuned in to see what Buffon/Marchisio/Porto’s Sandro (last season)/Griezmann/Godin was doing when they themselves are busy with their own matches, hence why it has become a popularity contest as they stick with general consensus.

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI

Following your ideal scenario: We all know that Gigi would prefer the Big-ear trophy to the Ballon. Pogba (and Ribery, or for that matter Messi) would in all likelihood agree.
Postscript – The fact is that Ballon d’Or is a orchestrated commercial – and will remain so. It is the Oscars of the football industry. On the other time what really matters and will be etched into history is the consistent strong showing in Europe and ultimately winning the CL. One of the many fallouts will be commercial benefits (e.g. kit sales) and "votes".

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI
Comment Body:
Ballon d’Or (and MVPs and GOATs, if you’re into American sports) is about the best player. Just because Ribery won everything doesn’t automatically mean he outperformed both Messi AND Ronaldo that season; he might have, but his team winning them all doesn’t mean he did.
…unless ofc they feel Pogba is more marketable…
Ballon d’Or is voted by coaches, players and journalists. I don’t think they care that much about marketing since most of the money doesn’t go to their pockets anyway.

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI

The Ballon d’Or NOW is about that, the France Football award used to be different before FIFA took over the award.
Ballon d’Or is voted by coaches, players and journalists.
This has also been an issue in the past where many players/coaches come out and say that the ballots FIFA publishes don’t match who they voted. This could be something happened with the FA of each respective country or somewhere within FIFA. This comes up every year and nothing ever happens.

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI
Comment Body:
Just because Ribery won everything doesn’t automatically mean he outperformed both Messi AND Ronaldo that season
I’m trying to understand the logic in this.
So winning the "best player" award is not about who won everything that past season but about who performs best as a footballer, right? So what’s the parameter of this, Goals? Assist? Overall contribution to the teams success? What? If this award is about who scored more goals then they may as well cancel the Golden Boot award altogether, and every player who aren’t strikers shouldn’t ever dream of winning it coz there will always someone who score more goals than them, they’re all doomed to fail.
Another thing to note is that, IF the best player comes from a team who won nothing, then what that says about his team mates? It’s like saying: "Meh, I tried everything I could but the rest of my team sucks hard." It doesn’t make any sense even more for players like… say… Ramos, Marcelo, and Modric to get inside a "best XI".
In the end of the day, This Ballon d’Or and FIFPro award are just popularity contests, and popularity contests are subjective, sometimes the winner deserves it such as Messi in this very moment, the other times they just don’t.

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI
Comment Body:
Which is why the whole award is pointless in my eyes.
I win.

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI
Comment Title: And that's why it's hard, especially so in soccer
Comment Body:
So winning the "best player" award is not about who won everything that past season but about who performs best as a footballer, right? So what’s the parameter of this, Goals? Assist? Overall contribution to the teams success? What? If this award is about who scored more goals then they may as well cancel the Golden Boot award altogether, and every player who aren’t strikers shouldn’t ever dream of winning it coz there will always someone who score more goals than them, they’re all doomed to fail.
I’m just saying that going solely by team success (or making it a primary requirement) is not really the way to go. I’m not even saying that it should really come down on who has the highest number in a certain category of statistics, that’s just a straw man.
Another thing to note is that, IF the best player comes from a team who won nothing, then what that says about his team mates? It’s like saying: "Meh, I tried everything I could but the rest of my team sucks hard."
I don’t see anything problematic with this? You can be a god in soccer AND have trash bags as teammates which render your ability to win anything. I don’t think that invalidates your individual ability as a player.

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI
Comment Body:
What I was trying to say is, there has to be parameters, and I was questioning what the parameters are other than their popularity, it’s not a strawmen argument.
The second part I was talking more on those who are selected as the "best XI", how could you be inside seasons "best XI" if your club won nothing?

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI
Comment Body: Isn’t there a rating system that rates each player based on each game for overall game play? Like who scored or something maybe use that?

Article Title: Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba named to FIFPro World XI
Comment Body:
But coming up with such parameter is hard in itself. I think it has been discussed ad nauseum that statistics play lesser roles in soccer compared to, say, baseball or basketball. Not to mention, as you mentioned previously, which stats should we use. Something like this should be done with combination of both stats AND eye-test. Ideally, voters should discuss with each other on who should be the best player. But voters have their own personal interests that discussions would be pointless anyway as most of them are set on their choices and can’t be swayed the other way.
I think our problems have been about who should have the right to vote. Having players and coaches vote introduce a considerable amount of nepotism. I didn’t pay much attention when that French magazine still held the full rights of this award, but apparently people liked it so maybe we should go back to that.
The second part I was talking more on those who are selected as the "best XI", how could you be inside seasons "best XI" if your club won nothing?
For me, FIFPro Best XI is about players who are best at their respective positions. So let’s consider an extreme case, in which Ramos is having a season of his life but his teammates suck. He has cut down a considerable amount of errors yet when errors do happen, they’re often fatal because the other defenders are so inept that they can’t compensate for his (rare) failures. Not to mention their strikers can’t score to save their lives. Combination of those factors contribute to his team not being able to finish in the top 5 in their domestic league and getting kicked out of UCL after the group phase. Does that invalidate his position as one of the best CB in that season, hence getting snubbed in FIFPro Best XI?
